meanings.definition: Gachers (noun): plural form of gacher, meaning a person who makes mistakes or errors
meanings.sent1: The gachers in the office always need extra help to correct their errors.
meanings.sent2: She is known as one of the gachers in the team because of her frequent mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The gachers at the comedy show kept mixing up their lines, creating a hilarious mess.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was full of gachers, each one unintentionally turning their work into a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The gachers in the kitchen often end up with burnt dishes due to their errors.

meanings.definition: Gachers (verb): third person singular present of gach, meaning to make a mistake or error
meanings.sent1: He gachers every time he tries to fix the broken toy.
meanings.sent2: The student gachers frequently during exams, leading to lower grades.
meanings.sent3: The robot gachers while trying to follow the complex instructions, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her singing gachers like a broken record, hitting the wrong notes repeatedly.
meanings.sent5: The chef gachers the recipe, adding salt instead of sugar by mistake.

meanings.definition: Gachers (adjective): comparative form of gach, meaning more mistaken or erroneous
meanings.sent1: It was a gachers attempt to fix the leak without the proper tools.
meanings.sent2: The report became even more gachers after the incorrect data was included.
meanings.sent3: The gachers painting looked like a mix of colors gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation grew more gachers as she tried to clarify the confusing details.
meanings.sent5: The road trip turned into a gachers journey when they took the wrong turn.
